requirement.summary: The SWID tag is schema valid
requirement.statement: When producing SWID tags, tag creators MUST produce SWID tags that conform to all requirements defined in the ISO/IEC 19770-2:2015 specification.

derived-requirement.statement: All SWID tag instances MUST pass a validating parse with no errors prior to performing any other processing.

requirement.summary: The default language is specified
requirement.statement: The <SoftwareIdentity> element MUST specify an @xml:lang attribute with a non-blank value to indicate the default human language used for expressing all language-dependent attribute values.

derived-requirement.statement: The <SoftwareIdentity> element MUST specify an @xml:lang attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> element does not specify an @xml:lang attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: The <SoftwareIdentity> element MUST specify a non-blank @xml:lang attribute value.
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> element does not specify a non-blank @xml:lang attribute value.

requirement.summary: The default language of the target platform is specified
requirement.statement: When specifying a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @xml:lang attribute, non-authoritative tag creators SHOULD use the language tag corresponding to the default language of the device where the tagged product resides.

requirement.summary: Each <Entity> element specifies a @regid value
requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element MUST provide an explicit (i.e., non-default) @regid attribute value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element MUST provide a @regid attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a @regid attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element MUST provide a non-blank @regid attribute value.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a blank @regid attribute value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element MUST provide a @regid attribute value other than "http://invalid.unavailable".
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a @regid attribute with the default @regid attribute value "http://invalid.unavailable".

requirement.summary: The "tagCreator" <Entity> element specifies a @regid value
requirement.statement: The <Entity> element containing the @role "tagCreator" MUST provide an explicit (i.e., non-default) @regid attribute value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element containing the @role "tagCreator" MUST provide a @regid attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a @regid attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element containing the @role "tagCreator" MUST provide a non-blank @regid attribute value.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a blank @regid attribute value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element containing the @role "tagCreator" MUST provide a @regid attribute value other than "http://invalid.unavailable".
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a @regid attribute with the default @regid attribute value "http://invalid.unavailable".

requirement.summary: Every <Entity> element specifies a @regid value
requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element SHOULD provide an explicit (i.e., non-default) @regid attribute value if such a value can be determined.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element SHOULD provide a @regid attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a @regid attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element SHOULD provide a non-blank @regid attribute value.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a blank @regid attribute value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> element SHOULD provide a @regid attribute value other than "http://invalid.unavailable".
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' has a @regid attribute with the default @regid attribute value "http://invalid.unavailable".

requirement.summary: <Entity> elements with the same @regid value have the same @role value
requirement.statement: All <Entity> elements that provide the same @regid attribute value MUST provide the same @role attribute values.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <Entity> with the same @regid value MUST have the same @role attribute values.
derived-requirement.message: The <Entity> with the @name ''{0}'' does not have matching @role attribute values with other <Entity> elements with the same @regid attribute value.

requirement.summary: Authoritative tags have an <Entity> that defines @role values for the "tagCreator" and a software provider role
requirement.statement: Authoritative tag creators MUST provide an <Entity> element where the @role attribute contains the value "tagCreator" and at least one of these additional role values: "aggregator", "distributor", "licensor", or "softwareCreator".

derived-requirement.statement: There MUST exist at least one <Entity> element that has a @role attribute that contains the value "tagCreator" and one or more of the following additional values: "aggregator", "distributor", "licensor", or "softwareCreator".
derived-requirement.message: An <Entity> doesn't exist that has a @role attribute with the value "tagCreator" and at least one of the following values: "aggregator", "distributor", "licensor", or "softwareCreator".

requirement.summary: Authoritative tags have an <Entity> for the "softwareCreator" @role
requirement.statement: Authoritative tag creators MUST provide an <Entity> element where the @role attribute contains the value "softwareCreator".

derived-requirement.statement: There MUST exist an <Entity> element that contains the @role 'softwareCreator'.
derived-requirement.message: An <Entity> element doesn't exist that has a @role attribute value of "softwareCreator".

requirement.summary: Non-authoritative tags have an <Entity> for the "softwareCreator" @role
requirement.statement: Non-authoritative tag creators SHOULD provide an <Entity> element where the @role attribute contains the value "softwareCreator".

derived-requirement.statement: An entity SHOULD be provided that has the @role attribute value "softwareCreator".
derived-requirement.message: An <Entity> element doesn't exist that has a @role attribute value of "softwareCreator".

requirement.summary: When the <Link> @href attribute value has the URI scheme 'swid', the schema specific part references the @tagId of the target tag.
requirement.statement: In order to link a source tag to a specific target tag whose @tagId is known at the time the source tag is created, tag creators MUST set the value of the <Link> @href attribute in the source tag to a URI with "swid:" as its scheme, followed by the @tagId of the target tag.

derived-requirement.statement: All <Link> elements with an @href attribute value with the "swid" URI scheme MUST have a URI schema specific part that is a valid tag identifier.
derived-requirement.message: The <Link> elements with an @href attribute value ''{0}'' is not a valid tag identifier. The URI syntax is invalid according to RFC 3986.

requirement.summary: When the <Link> @href attribute value has the URI scheme 'swidpath', the schema specific part contains a URI encoded valid XPath expression.
requirement.statement: When linking a source tag to one or more target tags whose @tagId value(s) cannot be determined at the time the source tag is created, tag creators MUST set the value of the <Link> @href attribute in the source tag to a URI with swidpath: as its scheme, followed by an XPath 2.0 [XPath20] conformant query. All characters contained in the XPath query which the URI specification [RFC3986] designates as reserved MUST be percent encoded per the URI specification. All embedded SWID tag elements in the query MUST be prefixed with the "swid:" namespace.

requirement.summary: When the <Link> @href attribute value has the URI scheme 'swidpath', the XPath is written to identify tags for which the XPath matches.
requirement.statement: Any XPath query used within a <Link> @href element MUST be designed in such a way that it can used by a system to iterate over a set of SWID tags and identify matching tags by applying the XPath query to each tag and checking for a non-empty result.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a @size value for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element MUST include a value for the @size attribute that specifies the size of the file in bytes.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element MUST provide a @size attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a @size attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element MUST provide a non-blank @size attribute value.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' has a blank @size attribute value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a @version value if a version is available for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element MUST include a value for the @version attribute, if one exists for the file.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element MUST provide a @version attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a @version attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: If a <File> element provided within a <Payload> or <Evidence> element includes a @version attribute, this attribute must be non-blank.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' has a blank @version attribute value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a hash value for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Every <File> element within a <Payload> element MUST include a hash value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element MUST provide at least one hash value for the referenced file
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a hash attribute value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a hash value for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Every <File> element within an <Evidence> element SHOULD include a hash value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element SHOULD provide at least one hash value for the referenced file
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a hash attribute value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a hash value for the referenced file with sufficient security strength
requirement.statement: Whenever <Payload> or <Evidence> elements are included in a tag, every <File> element SHOULD avoid the inclusion of hash values based on hash functions with insufficient security strength (< 128 bits).

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element SHOULD avoid providing hash values based on the MD5 hash function
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' provides a MD5 hash value which has an insufficient security strength (64 bits < 128 bits).

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element SHOULD avoid providing hash values based on the SHA1 hash function
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' provides a SHA1 hash value which has an insufficient security strength (80 bits < 128 bits).

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element SHOULD avoid providing hash values based on the SHA224 hash function
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' provides a SHA224 hash value which has an insufficient security strength (112 bits < 128 bits).

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element SHOULD avoid providing hash values based on the SHA224 hash function
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' provides a SHA224 hash value which has an insufficient security strength (80 bits < 128 bits).

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a SHA-256 hash value for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Whenever a <Payload> element is included in a tag, every <File> element contained therein MUST provide a hash value based on the SHA-256 hash function.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided inside a <Payload> element MUST provide a hash value based on the SHA-256 hash function.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provide a SHA256 hash value.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided inside a <Payload> element MUST provide a valid SHA256 hash attribute value based on the SHA-256 hash function.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' has an invalid SHA256 hash value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element provides a SHA-256 hash value for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Whenever an <Evidence> element is included in a tag, every <File> element contained therein SHOULD provide a hash value based on the SHA-256 hash function.

derived-requirement.statement: Every <File> element provided inside a <Evidence> element MUST provide a hash value based on the SHA-256 hash function.
derived-requirement.message: The <File> element with the @name ''{0}'' does not provides a SHA256 hash value.

requirement.summary: Every <File> element optionally provides a SHA-384, SHA-512, and/or SHA-512/256 hash hash values for the referenced file
requirement.statement: Whenever a <Payload> or <Evidence> element is included in a tag, every <File> element contained therein MAY additionally provide hash values based on the SHA-384, SHA-512, and/or SHA-512/256 hash functions.

requirement.summary: A @n8060:pathSeparator value is provided for <Payload> and <Evidence> elements
requirement.statement: The @n8060:pathSeparator extension attribute SHOULD be used within <Payload> and <Evidence> elements to specify the path separator character used in embedded <File> and <Directory> elements.

derived-requirement.statement: A <Payload> or <Evidence> element SHOULD provide a @n8060:pathSeparator attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <{0}> element does not provide a @n8060:pathSeparator attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: If the <Payload> or <Evidence> element provides a @n8060:pathSeparator attribute, the attribute's value MUST be non-blank.
derived-requirement.message: The <{0}> element has a blank {1} attribute value.

requirement.summary: An @n8060:envVarPrefix value is provided for <Payload> and <Evidence> elements
requirement.statement: The @n8060:envVarPrefix extension attribute SHOULD be used within <Payload> and <Evidence> elements to specify the character(s) used to prefix environment variables that may be embedded <File> and <Directory> elements.

derived-requirement.statement: A <Payload> or <Evidence> element SHOULD provide a @n8060:envVarPrefix attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <{0}> element does not provide a @n8060:envVarPrefix attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: If the <Payload> or <Evidence> element provides a @n8060:envVarPrefix attribute, the attribute's value MUST be non-blank.
derived-requirement.message: The <{0}> element has a blank {1} attribute value.

requirement.summary: An @n8060:envVarSuffix value is provided for <Payload> and <Evidence> elements
requirement.statement: The @n8060:envVarSuffix extension attribute SHOULD be used within <Payload> and <Evidence> elements to specify the character(s) used to suffix environment variables that may be embedded <File> and <Directory> elements.

derived-requirement.statement: A <Payload> or <Evidence> element SHOULD provide a @n8060:envVarSuffix attribute.
derived-requirement.message: The <{0}> element does not provide a @n8060:envVarSuffix attribute.

requirement.summary: The <SoftwareIdentity> @tagId value is not changed when the tag is revised
The <SoftwareIdentity> @tagVersion value is changed when the tag is revised
The corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus value is "true", and @patch and @supplemental values are "false"
requirement.statement: If the value of the <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute is set to "true", then the values of <SoftwareIdentity> @patch and @supplemental MUST be set to "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value MUST be "true".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value is not "true".

derived-requirement.statement: A corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value is not "false".

requirement.summary: If the software is versioned, the corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @version provides a value.
requirement.statement: If a software product has been assigned a version by the software provider, that version MUST be specified in the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute of the product's corpus tag, if any.

requirement.summary: A corpus tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute value is provided when a @version attribute value is provided.
requirement.statement: If a corpus tag contains a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute, it MUST also contain a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute.

requirement.summary: The corpus tag contains a <Payload> element enumerating all files included in the tagged installation media.
requirement.statement: A corpus tag MUST contain a <Payload> element that enumerates every file that is included in the tagged installation media.

requirement.summary: The primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus, @patch, and @supplemental values are "false"
requirement.statement: To indicate that a tag is a primary tag, the <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus, @patch, and @supplemental attributes MUST be set to "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value is not "false".

requirement.summary: If the software is versioned, the primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute value is provided.
requirement.statement: If a software product has been assigned a version by the software provider, that version MUST be specified in the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute of the product's primary tag.

derived-requirement.statement: A primary tag SHOULD provide a <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute, if such a version value exists.
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> element does not provide a @version attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: If a primary tag provides a <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute, this attribute's value MUST be non-blank.
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> element has a blank @version attribute value.

requirement.summary: A primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute value is provided when a @version attribute value is provided.
requirement.statement: If a primary tag contains a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute, it MUST also contain a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute.

derived-requirement.statement: If the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute is provided, then the <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute MUST provide a value.
If the <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute is provided, then the attribute value MUST be non-blank.

requirement.summary: If the software is versioned and that version can be determined, the primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute is assigned that version value.
requirement.statement: If a software product has been assigned a version by the software provider, and that version can be determined, the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute of the primary tag MUST contain that value.

requirement.summary: If the software is versioned and the versioning scheme can be determined, the primary tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute is assigned that version value.
requirement.statement: If a primary tag contains a value for the <SoftwareIdentity> @version attribute, and the version scheme of that @version attribute value can be determined, the <SoftwareIdentity> @versionScheme attribute of the primary tag MUST contain that version scheme value.

requirement.summary: A <Payload> element is provided in the primary tag.
requirement.statement: A <Payload> element SHOULD be provided in a software product's primary tag.

derived-requirement.summary: A <Payload> element is provided in the primary tag.
derived-requirement.statement: A <Payload> element SHOULD be provided in a software product's primary tag.
derived-requirement.message: A <Payload> element was not provided.

derived-requirement.summary: An <Evidence> element is not provided in the primary tag.
derived-requirement.statement: An <Evidence> element MUST NOT be provided in a software product's primary tag.
derived-requirement.message: An <Evidence> element was provided, instead of a <Payload> element.

requirement.summary: An <Evidence> element is provided in the primary tag.
requirement.statement: An <Evidence> element SHOULD be provided in a software product's primary tag.

derived-requirement.summary: A <Evidence> element is provided in the primary tag.
derived-requirement.statement: A <Evidence> element SHOULD be provided in a software product's primary tag.
derived-requirement.message: A <Evidence> element was not provided.

derived-requirement.summary: An <Payload> element is not provided in the primary tag.
derived-requirement.statement: An <Payload> element MUST NOT be provided in a software product's primary tag.
derived-requirement.message: An <Payload> element was provided, instead of a <Evidence> element.

requirement.summary: The <Payload> or <Evidence> element lists all files comprising the tagged product.
requirement.statement: <Payload> and <Evidence> elements SHOULD list every file comprising the product described by the tag.

derived-requirement.statement: At least one file comprising the tagged product MUST appear in the <Payload> or <Evidence> element.
derived-requirement.message: While it is impossible to know if every file is listed in a tag, a software installation will contain one or more files that can be identified.

requirement.summary: The <Payload> element lists all machine instruction files comprising the tagged product.
requirement.statement: If the <Payload> element is provided, it MUST list every machine instruction file comprising the product described by the tag.

requirement.summary: The <Evidence> element lists all machine instruction files comprising the tagged product.
requirement.statement: If the <Evidence> element is provided, it MUST list every machine instruction file comprising the product described by the tag.

requirement.summary: Any file referenced by a <Payload> <File> element that may change in size, version, or hash value is marked with the @n8060:mutable extension attribute with the value "true".
requirement.statement: If a <File> element included in a <Payload> element of a primary tag describes a file that can undergo authorized changes over time in ways that could alter its size, version, and/or hash value, the tag creator MUST set that file's <File> @n8060:mutable extension attribute to "true".

requirement.summary: Any file referenced by an <Evidence> <File> element that may change in size, version, or hash value is marked with the @n8060:mutable extension attribute with the value "true".
requirement.statement: If it can be determined that a <File> element included in an <Evidence> element of a primary tag describes a file that can undergo authorized changes over time in ways that could alter its size, version, and/or hash value, the tag creator SHOULD set that file's <File> @n8060:mutable extension attribute to "true".

requirement.summary: A <Meta> element is provided with values for the @product, @colloquialVersion, @revision, and @edition attributes.
requirement.statement: If appropriate values exist and can be determined, a <Meta> element MUST be provided and MUST furnish values for as many of the following attributes as possible: @product, @colloquialVersion, @revision, and @edition.

derived-requirement.statement: A <Meta> element MUST be provided, if appropriate values exist and can be determined for the @product, @colloquialVersion, @revision, and @edition attributes.
derived-requirement.message: The <Meta> element was not provided.

derived-requirement.statement: A value for the <Meta> @product attribute MUST be provided, if appropriate values exist and can be determined.
derived-requirement.message: The <Meta> @product attribute was not provided.

derived-requirement.statement: A value for the <Meta> @colloquialVersion attribute MUST be provided, if appropriate values exist and can be determined.
derived-requirement.message: The <Meta> @colloquialVersion attribute was not provided.

derived-requirement.statement: A value for the <Meta> @revision attribute MUST be provided, if appropriate values exist and can be determined.
derived-requirement.message: The <Meta> @revision attribute was not provided.

derived-requirement.statement: A value for the <Meta> @edition attribute MUST be provided, if appropriate values exist and can be determined.
derived-requirement.message: The <Meta> @edition attribute was not provided.

requirement.summary: The patch tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @patch value is "true", and @corpus and @supplemental values are "false"
requirement.statement: If the value of the <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute is set to "true", then the values of <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus and <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental MUST be set to "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A patch tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A patch tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value MUST be "true".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value is not "true".

derived-requirement.statement: A patch tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value is not "false".

requirement.summary: The patch tag enumerates all files added, modified, or removed by the patch.
requirement.statement: A patch tag SHOULD contain a <Payload> element that MUST enumerate every file that is modified, removed, or added by the patch.

requirement.summary: The patch tag indicates which files were added, modified, or removed by the patch.
requirement.statement: Each <File> element contained within the <Payload> element of a patch tag MUST include an extension attribute named @n8060:patchEvent, which has one of the following values: 1) The string value "modify" to indicate that the patch modifies a pre-existing installed file, 2) The string value "remove" to indicate that the patch removes a pre-existing installed file, or 3) The string value "add" to indicate that the patch installs a new file that did not previously exist.

derived-requirement.statement: Each <File> element contained within the <Payload> element of a patch tag MUST include an extension attribute named @n8060:patchEvent, with a value of modify, remove, or add.

requirement.summary: The patch tag enumerates all files changed by the patch.
requirement.statement: A patch tag SHOULD contain an <Evidence> element that enumerates every file that was found to have changed as a result of the patch process.

derived-requirement.statement: At least one file comprising the tagged patch SHOULD appear in the <Evidence> element.
derived-requirement.message: While it is impossible to know if every file to be listed in a patch tag, a software patch installation will contain one or more files that may be identifiable.

requirement.summary: The supplemental tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental value is "true", and @corpus and @patch values are "false"
requirement.statement: If the value of the <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute is set to "true", then the values of <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus and <SoftwareIdentity> @patch MUST be set to "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A supplemental tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @corpus attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A supplemental tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value MUST be "false".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @patch attribute value is not "false".

derived-requirement.statement: A supplemental tag's <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value MUST be "true".
derived-requirement.message: The <SoftwareIdentity> @supplemental attribute value is not "true".

requirement.summary: The supplemental tag has a <Link> element with @rel="supplemental", with an @href attribute pointing to the supplemented tag.
requirement.statement: A supplemental tag MUST contain a <Link> element to associate itself with the individual tag that it supplements. The @rel attribute of this <Link> element MUST be set to "supplemental".

derived-requirement.summary: The supplemental tag has a <Link> element with @rel="supplemental"
derived-requirement.statement: A supplemental tag MUST contain a <Link> element with the @rel attribute having the value "supplemental".

derived-requirement.summary: The supplemental tag has a <Link> element with @rel="supplemental", with an @href attribute pointing to the supplemented tag using the "swid" or "swidpath" scheme.
derived-requirement.statement: A supplemental tag MUST contain a <Link> element with the @rel attribute having the value "supplemental", with the @href attribute value's scheme assigned to either "swid" or "swidpath".

requirement.summary: TBD
requirement.statement: If a supplemental tag provides a data value that conflicts with corresponding data values in the tag being supplemented, the data value in the supplemented tag MUST be considered to be the correct value.
